implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the REST API endpoint for creating a new task. Accepts a TaskCreate object with title, description, priority, due date, and user_name, and delegates creation to the service layer.
implementation.name: create_task (POST /tasks)
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with task data:
    TRY
        Call task_service.create_task(task)
        RETURN created task
    EXCEPT Exception as e
        Raise HTTP 400 with error message

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements business logic for creating a task. Logs the operation and passes the task data to the repository for persistence.
implementation.name: TaskService.create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Log 'Creating task for user: {user_name}'
Call repository.add_task(task_data)
RETURN created task

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the actual storage of the new task. Creates a Task object with the provided attributes, assigns a unique ID, stores it in memory, and returns the created task.
implementation.name: TaskRepository.add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Create Task object with:
    id = next available id
    title, description, priority, due_date, user_name from task_data
Append Task to internal task list
Increment id counter
Log 'Task created: {task}'
RETURN created task

missing_implementations: No persistent database storage; tasks are stored in memory only.
No UI component for task creation (no frontend implementation).
